item.title: Toothless Bear gets Teeth
item.description: This American black bear (Ursus americanus) was donated to the ANU to raise awareness of illegal trafficing and animal imports. Along the way, the bear lost her original fishy mouthful was feeling a bit toothless. The Ecology and Evolution group at the Australian National University tasked me with fiting her for prosthesis and doing a touch-up. This included cleaning the mouth and preparing it for new teeth, 3D printing some teeth from a CT scan, editing them down to fit the bearâ€™s age, sculpting a new palate seating and painting it.
